THE ROLE OF SHARIAH LAW IN NIGERIAN STATES

Source: United States Department of State, 2006.
Type of Law Number of States (total of 36)
Shariah law applies all cases, including criminal law 9
Shariah law applies in personal status issues only 3
Shariah law plays no role in the judicial system 24

choicesHtml: Nigerian states that use Shariah law are located in the north.
Common law is practiced in large Nigerian cities, but rural areas have courts that practice Shariah law.
Shariah law is most common in the oil-producing region of Nigeria, while the rest of the country has courts practicing common law.
Only a minority of Nigerian states have courts practicing Shariah law because it is not in compliance with international law.
